item.title: Report E-2024090135
item.description:
Report E-2024090135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: KENTWOOD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024, three (3) 30-gallon drums of hypochlorite solution had faulty packaging and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the tops of the drums. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel placed the three (3) damaged 30-gallon drums into three (3) 95-gallon overpack drums that were staged for further handling by R+L terminal personnel. All undamaged freight was restacked for further shipment and processing.

item.title: Report E-2024090131
item.description:
Report E-2024090131

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO XGR contacted ERTS to report a hazardous cargo release. ERTS dispatched SET Environmental to assist with clean up. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and a 5ft-by-5ft area of the asphalt underneath the trailer and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released. SET Environmental personnel transferred the remaining material into a new tote, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged tote and recovered material were placed into four (4) 55-gallon metal drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
